TopicTitle: Why can't I turn off PAIGE KSP2

Articles.Content: PAIGE..,... how do I turn her off she keeps popping up every time I do something no madder how many times I do it. As a veteran KSP player I didn't need any help for a tutorial then and I don't now she gets in the way becomes very annoying and shouldn't really be there unless I actually pick tutorial. at least put a turn off button in settings instead of making me make a whole new game.

start a new save and be sure to turn off "first time user experience".

i generally dont like being talked down to by somone a quarter of my age. 

Edited February 25, 2023 by Nuke

56 minutes ago, Nuke said:

start a new save and be sure to turn off "first time user experience".

i generally dont like being talked down to by somone a quarter of my age. 

So, I did that after my first flight around the Mun and back when I realized I couldn't turn off that nonsense mid-save (er, mid-"Campaign.") Started a new save, turned off the "First Time User Experience", then launched the Kerbal X-2 to go orbit the Mun. Along the way, besides realizing the stock decoupler in the design gets "stuck" on the Poodle nozzles and won't fully separate the stage until you pause and then restart the game a couple times ... sorry, separate bug), once I entered orbit around the Mun I sent Val outside for an EVA. Suddenly out of the blue, despite the New User Experience being disabled, I got P.A.I.G.E popping up again to tell me this vessel (presumably Val?) was out of fuel. What the heck?

of you found that bug too. that has been bugging me all day. for some reason fuel will skip over a decoupler if there isnt also an engine in the way. ive always preferred side mounted engines on landers.
